title: Tryn so fuckin annoying
body:
I know tryndamere isnt op or anything but holy shit is that an annoying champion.I understand his early game can be punished...i understand he is aa reliant......i understand that he just needs to be ccd....but still...The dude is so fuckin annoying to deal with.Start game out harras the fucked deny him cs , maybe kill him.But then the fucker just
keeps
csing...and pushing...eventually gettin turets and forcing you to stay in lane...heaven forbid he manages to get an inhib and your forced to push that out as the melee tank with no damage that you have been forced to build in order to be able to somewhat handle him.....oh and need i remind you...your not allowed to leave top because he will keep splitting...all...
game...long.....then u finnaly catch the fucker.....and he manages to slip away and cut thru ur turets when he has no hp and manage to escape with a sliver of hp as u walk away thinking turet will kill him...fuck..this...champ...so ...anti...fun.........................roar...fuck rfuudenwokewo

replies.body:
The most annoying thing is he can win or lose trades/all-ins based on luck. 

One time, I was fighting against one and in 4 attacks he critted none, even with full rage bar. After that, I snowballed and he didn't have a chance.

Another time, he crit me 3 times in a row and killed me easily. He snowballed, and I got no chance. 

His RNG design is so frustrating.  The "don't engage with full rage bar" strategy is really stupid.

it´s not "his" RNG though, it´s just the general problem of Crits in this game. The same happens once an ADC rushes IE - a 20%chance to deal almost 3times the dmg is just waay too impactfull. If they´d just take further what they did with Ashe a lot of this would be solved.
I lost lane once cause his first aa on me (he had no fury) was a crit due to 1% crit rune...Then his next aa was another crit, ignited and look at that he got 3 crits in a row...
he must be part of the secret brotherhood of 1% crit

Could be worse.
Cait Triple crits with Headshot are brutal.
3 crits with a 1% rune? That's stupidly unlikely given psuedo RNG mechanics. Damn... sure he wasn't running full crit chance runes or something?
I just kind of hate his mobility as a high damage fighter with sustain and pretty annoying cc :/

> [{quoted}](name=moberrybusiness,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=wE0AdGri,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-05-26T06:20:00.653+0000)
>
> I just kind of hate his mobility 


Has one dash...
Meanwhile, {{champion:92}}

> [{quoted}](name=Mcrarburger,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=wE0AdGri,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2015-05-26T07:16:44.156+0000)
>
> Has one dash...
> Meanwhile, {{champion:92}}

Her dash only goes through the tiniest walls, whereas Tryndamere goes through 9/10 of them, then when you get to him, which you won't, base ms OP, he'll have it again

2 AoE hard CCs, mini dashes aka slow immunity. Encouraged to build CDR and in most cases starts with 10% CDR.

Before this patch, Trynd and Riven had the exact same base movespeed. Now the difference is **5**.

What I hate about him is that he can choose to kill someone before he dies, and depending on champion, they can't actually do anything about it.  Playing a squishy support with an enemy Trynd?  If he is determined to kill you before he dies, he will, no counterplay.  You can't CC him for long enough to not get hit at all, and his shout, movement speed and dash means that you can't run away.

{{champion:78}} 

Sounds familiar :P
Because of Poopy I will forever fear Oompa Loompas and the Lollipop Guild.
literally the only champ i h8 facing over any champ to ever exist

> no counterplay

as someone who mained tryndamere for over a year, you have no idea how much hair i am ripping out right now hearing you say that he has no counterplay and that you cant keep him from getting to you.

{{champion:268}} *SHURIMA!*

---------------------------

Bit of fun food for thought.
The problem with what you're saying is, the first 3 guys counter Trynd in lane. Not sure about {{champion:2}}, though he has his ult and Q to escape Trynd for that matter.

The first 3 are people that he can easily stay on top of.
The next 4 can't kill him.
The last 8 are ADC's that can kite him to death with relative ease (well, Quinn is debateably an ADC).

And Azir is just Azir.

{{champion:86}} *DEMACIA!*

You just took two words from my post out of context.

Tell me how I'm supposed to counter a Tryndamere who is determined to kill me as *Soraka*, for example?

> [{quoted}](name=Nameless Voice,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=wE0AdGri,comment-id=000700020001,timestamp=2015-05-26T22:36:59.214+0000)
>
> You just took two words from my post out of context.
> 
> Tell me how I'm supposed to counter a Tryndamere who is determined to kill me as *Soraka*, for example?

let your tank handle him. rotate cc. you have a snare on your aoe silence.

have you considered building twin shadows to kite him with the active? you cant 1v1 him. youre not supposed to. but there are options to slow him down.

actually, those two words seemed to me to be the gist of your comment, which is why I picked them.

as for soraka, she's one of the easier champs to deal with him as.  she has 2 huge heals, a silence that also roots, and a slow.  and that's just you.  that doesn't include the at least decent amount of cc that the rest of your team has.  everyone underestimates the havoc that slows wreak on him.

ps: exhaust absolutely destroys him.  imo, more than ignite.

Two huge heals?  You're thinking of pre-rework Soraka.  Now she has a 65-130 heal (+40-80% AP), on a slow skillshot that is very hard to hit on a fast/mobile champion like Tryndamere, the same applies to her slow.  Other than that, she only has her ult.  Silence doesn't do anything against Trynd since he just autoattacks (and it doesn't stop him using his ult), and if she's using it defensively to peel Trynd, she's dead before the root procs.
Exhaust - yup, that's good against him, though it has a long cooldown and he can still kill you through it if he has 3-4 items.

Okay this is a good one lol you almost had me at no counterplay

He's not CC immune, why do you think Trynd has almost never been competitively viable? Because a 0 cs support that's half decent makes him dead weight

the best thing to do against a trynd is to kite with slow. frozen mallet and rylai's are great items but this also depends on who you are as well. obviously randuin's and frozen heart are good counters as well. and if you want to be that guy, thornmail is always an option. if looking for champs who counter, karma is someone who can easily kite.

Quinn is my favorite counter to Trynd. :D If he dashes at you, you just Vault off his stupid face. If he slows you, you just pop BotRK. If somehow he STILL catches you, you just ult and bird-o away. CAW CAW!!  And even if ALL THAT doesn't work, you just blind him with Q. It's perfect.

why ult before q?

I would blind him with q once he reached me, aa him until the blind is gone, then vault off him and keep shrekin unless I really need to run, then id just vault and botrk/ult

Hardest trynd counter that there is.
blind slow knockback
can ult when he does and run away then chase him down and execute when ult ends.

He's not OP by any means, but he is fucking annoying, yeah.

Mostly because of his Crit-centered cheese, lvl 6 powerspike and just as Nasus, you can't really lose sight of him for a minute because otherwise he will be pushing so balls deep.

{{champion:23}} is a fucking scumbag. I own almost everyskin for him because my bf always mystery gifts me shit for him. I played him for the first time this season and I always win lane. It's like RNG God loves me because level 1 Im getting off two back to back crits with no crit runes EVERY SINGLE GAME. His sustain is stupidly high and with that spin it's incredibly easy to escape ganks. Post 6 you should never die to a gank.

I'm honestly about to just main him and climb to plat.

Nerf {{champion:23}} So {{champion:114}} will be the highest win rate melee adc once more!
Hail {{item:3074}}
Heil Heidrah!!! {{item:3074}}

I believe {{champion:114}} needs a buff 

her early game is so low she needs a {{item:1038}} built in base damage to compete 

her mid game is terrible too they should really put a {{item:3026}} into her passive and turn her q into skillshot

her late game is the worst they should scale her with at least {{item:3072}} {{item:3072}} {{item:3072}} {{item:3072}} built into her lategame

why shouldn't they? its not like anyone on Boards is willing to deny she needs a buff for like the longest time.

IMO only thing Fiora needs is for her ult to **actually make her untargetable and immune to AoE damage as untargetable suggests.**
Its buggy as all hell. I've been killed by Amumu and Blitz ults one too many times-- its not consistent, but it happens.

> [{quoted}](name=Critmaster Garen,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=wE0AdGri,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2015-05-26T07:51:26.330+0000)
>
> {{item:3075}}
> 
> its really really easy to deal with him. ive bought this item, and zoned tryns, and they simply didnt know what to do. he gets close to cs, you attack him. he tries to fight back, hes hurting himself more than you.
> 
> you dont even need to leave lane.

That doesn't actually help unless your champion has massive inbuilt sustain, health steroids, and good base damages. Tryndamere doesn't have to kill you, just hurt you a bit, heal, then repeat the process until you are forced to go b or die. Since most of the time Trynd rushes BotRK (or at least the cutlass) he'll have good lifesteal for minions and his Q for a 300 hp heal, letting him slowly wear you down before sealing a turret.

> [{quoted}](name=Lord Dusteon,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=wE0AdGri,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2015-05-26T11:49:14.238+0000)

> That doesn't actually help unless your champion has massive inbuilt sustain, health steroids, and good base damages. Tryndamere doesn't have to kill you, just hurt you a bit, heal, then repeat the process until you are forced to go b or die. Since most of the time Trynd rushes BotRK (or at least the cutlass) he'll have good lifesteal for minions and his Q for a 300 hp heal, letting him slowly wear you down before sealing a turret.

get some lifesteal then. i promise you, youre gonna finish a vamp scepter and a thornmail before he hits 6.

and the point is not to let him get towards minions. you rush a thornmail, then zone him as he cant fight you anymore. any time he goes towards minions, you attack him. you just sit behind his minion line, so hes zoned from farm and xp.

> [{quoted}](name=Critmaster Garen,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=wE0AdGri,comment-id=000500000000,timestamp=2015-05-26T12:09:59.993+0000)

> and the point is not to let him get towards minions. you rush a thornmail, then zone him as he cant fight you anymore. any time he goes towards minions, you attack him. you just sit behind his minion line, so hes zoned from farm and xp.

2900 gold before <any champion> hits level 6? U wot.

trynd just builds  {{item:1053}} x2 and ignores you
pve lane till {{item:3087}}  and {{item:3153}}

> [{quoted}](name=StealWolverine,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=wE0AdGri,comment-id=00050003,timestamp=2015-05-26T22:04:14.406+0000)
>
> trynd just builds  {{item:1053}} x2 and ignores you
> pve lane till {{item:3087}}  and {{item:3153}}

thats not how it works...

what champion are you playing that you dont do enough damage to him, that he can just ignore you with 2 vamp scepters? seriously. if that really happens, youre not aggressive enough, letting him even close to creeps without 100 to 0 ing him, forcing him to burn his ult (which he doesnt have available every creepwave).

or youre stupid enough to push the lane, letting him lasthit and lifesteal under his turret, instead of freezing the lane.

i havent lost a single lane against a tryn this season. its really not that hard. rush a thornmail and play aggressive. freeze the lane, zone him, kill him when he tries to cs or even get close to creeps, then push the lane into the turret while hes dead, then freeze again.

you dont need a champ with incredibly crazy sustain. just enough to outsustain the little damage he could do to you with a thornmail in your inventory. and hes going to hurt himself more than hes going to hurt you. at some point youre gonna have a large enough gold lead to easily deal with him.

> [{quoted}](name=Bharhash,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=wE0AdGri,comment-id=0005000100000000,timestamp=2015-05-26T18:13:55.167+0000)
>
> Now, it's kind of unreasonable to assume that someone would get enough gold for a thornmail before Tryndamere hits 6, but I do agree that it's a very good early game counter. 
> 
> I actually had a game as Trynd vs a Nasus who rushed Thornmail. At that point, I had to stop and just farm. I couldn't try to trade with Nasus because he would end up beating me. Once I got a BotRK though, and especially after a Last Whisper, I could very easily go in and trade with Nasus.
> 
> Tryndamere is a champ that has to be matched with someone who has the CC / Sustain / Tankiness in order to counter / invalidate him. You need someone with some good targeted CC (Pantheon or Ryze), ranged harass (Pantheon or Gnar), or excellent sustain (Cho'gath) to shut him down, and you can very easily shut him down with the above champs.

ok, now imagine youre not playing against a nasus who doesnt have any trade potential unti midgame, but against an actual lane bully with a thornmail in his inventory, whos repeatedly beating the snot out of you and tries to engage on you. and you cant even hit back, because youll just die faster.

the point of the thornmail rush is to beat and zone a tryn so hard very early on, that you finish 2 more items before he can scratch enough farm together to finish his bork.

but you have to play a champion along with it, who can really apply pressure to him. 

maybe its just because im usually playing garen against him and get a 125 armor out of the thornmail. but im pretty sure other champions can deal with him in the same manner.

> [{quoted}](name=Critmaster Garen,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=wE0AdGri,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2015-05-26T07:51:26.330+0000)

{{item:3156}} {{item:3153}} {{item:3035}} 
U wot

> [{quoted}](name=aaronconlin,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=wE0AdGri,comment-id=00050001,timestamp=2015-05-26T13:47:27.791+0000)
>

> U wot

YES. hes gonna get those 3 items before you get the 2k gold for a thornmail together...

the point of the thornmail is to beat him and completely screw him over before he even gets to that point. thats why its the first item you buy against him, before you even upgrade your boots to tabi.

I disliked him until I actually played him. Most people don't abuse him when his CD's are down, and don't cc him. I'd honestly much rather play against a Tryn, than a Riven or even Irelia. I think that's true with most champions. If more people actually played them they'd see when they're at their weakest to take advantage of it.

Tryndamere invalidates every melee champion with maybe the exception of a good Irelia or Darius. But even when his passive is full, you can't really duel him.

Due to his debuffs and dash/slice/whatever you wanna call it, it's also very hard to kite him and most ADCs can easily die instantly to Tryndamere.

Recently I've seen a full Attack Speed Tryndamere, all of his runes he could get had Attack Speed on them and his first item was Attack Speed and he ended up carrying th game, pushing top lane to our Nexus Turrets because very few people besides our Ziggs could stop him (only our ADC and Mid were ranged.).

I don't think calling Tryndamere overpowered is wrong, he needs to be nerfed even if he is technically not "overpowered". He invalidates a huge majority of the game from ever being able to fight him with a Level 1 Infinity Edge built into his kit due to his free critical chance and free attack damage. He has too much sustain and get-out-of-jail-free cards and it needs to be nerfed, even if he isn't played in the LCS or have a 60% win rate, it still changes nothing as his kit is so extremely toxic on top of him being the easiest champion in the game, even easier than Master Yi, he needs to be nerfed.

When a champion's kit is this toxic then there is obviously an issue with the champion itself.

Personally they should max his critical hit at 15% and also make him unable to use his ultimate while under crowd control.

{{champion:36}}  {{champion:31}} {{champion:24}} {{champion:126}} {{champion:105}} {{champion:54}} {{champion:75}} {{champion:92}} {{champion:102}} 
all can do decent against him if good.
you forgot to add almost every other champion in the game

The laneing phase.
Trundle: IT NEVER STOPS!!

Oh what's that, you won lane?
Good thing laning phase never ends when vs tryn

Yeah, reason why Tryn is never allowed to be good is because much like Master Yi and Riven, you need your entire team composition to counter him specifically.  If you have a ton of hard CC, Tryn's made irrelevant.  If you don't, he roflstomps you and gets pentakills effortlessly.  At least you can plan a team composition against him and still invalidate him as a champion.  Unlike certain others I know of... *cough {{champion:78}} cough.
i main him lol dude i love his infinite sustain and the fact that he is damn near impossible to gank if he has ghost and e ready
hahahahahahaha
